intro: Chiritopsis subulata, commonly known as the slender chiritopsis, is a flowering plant native to South America, particularly Argentina and Chile. It belongs to the Asteraceae family, which includes daisies and sunflowers, and is characterized by its composite flower heads. The plant typically grows in arid or semi-arid environments, thriving in well-drained soils and full sun. Its small, narrow leaves and yellow flowers make it a distinctive species within its native range. It is often found in rocky or gravelly habitats, showcasing its adaptability to harsh conditions.
